intro.title: When Someone Dies: Your First Steps
intro.subtitle: We understand this is an overwhelming time. Take a deep breath – you don't have to do everything at once, and we're here to help you through each step.

steps.title: Take a Moment
steps.description: If the death has just occurred, there's no immediate rush. Take time to be with your loved one if you wish. Stay still and when you're ready, move to the next steps.

steps.title: Call for Help
steps.description:
Call us first at 0151 928 1625 – we have a funeral director available at all times.
We'll guide you through everything that needs to happen and take as much of the burden as possible, allowing you time to collect your thoughts.
If the person who has died is at home or in a nursing home a suitably qualified medic will need to verify the death has occurred before we can transfer them into our care.

steps.title: Medical Certification
steps.description: A doctor will need to certify the death.:
list: A doctor who treated your loved one will complete a Medical Certificate of Cause of Death.
A Medical Examiner will review this and call you to discuss any concerns and explain the cause of death.
Once discussed and approved, the information is sent to the Registrar.

steps.title: Register the Death
steps.description: You'll need to make an appointment at the Register Office. Don't worry if you can't do this immediately, you will need to take some personal items with you.
steps.subtitle: What to bring (if available):
list: Birth certificate or passport of your loved one
Details about their occupation and pension

steps.title: Special Circumstances
steps.description: If the death was unexpected, sudden, or occurred in certain circumstances, the Coroner may be involved. This is routine procedure and nothing to worry about – we'll support you through this process if needed.

remember.title: Remember:
points: You don't have to remember everything – we'll remind you what's needed.
It's okay to ask for help from family and friends.
remember.highlight: Your first call to us is often the hardest. Once you've called us, we'll be with you every step of the way.
